What is this? Looks like a RWBY animation.
That's Ace Attorney

I don't know, 
maybe?
I hate anime personally

Why do you hate anime?

(RWBY is an Anime-inspired Cartoon btw.)

While some storylines are interesting, I'd rather not have to listen to Japanese with english subtitles or broken engrish.

I'm also not into the "fanservice" a lot of them have

RWBY is considered by a lot a people to be an anime, or close enough that it doesn't matter

Except that people who have done their research know it's a 3D show with special effects not a 2D show where most animes come from. Plus, it's an American show so the main language is English.

Having watched through all of it and then some, there isn't any fan-service in it that i've noticed at least.

RWBY is an American show! Language issues are not a problem there.

And tbh I don't really understand why it's considered anime? It's closer to Toy Story than anime, as it's 3D CGI rather than 2D animation. It just has anime stylings, much as Toy Story has western cartoon stylings. It's okay not to like that style of art, but let me foist my annoying pedantry on you to make sure you dislike it for the right reasons! >.>

Or ignore me. People who are unfettered by pedantry are probably better off overall anyways. Besides, anime 「アニメ」 is lit. "animated film or cartoon", so technically if we're speaking Japanese it's a mostly-correct usage of the word. It just has a different meaning in English.

Obviously this is all very important in M&G. M&G is all about correct inter-lingual grammar, after all. Non-grammatical fun is forbidden. :P
Probably the style of the characters is similar. I think people less hate anime and more the kind of style that usually comes with it 95% of the time, so therefore basically hating anime.
Fair enough. I don't know too much on the subject. I think the last time I watched anime (Miyakazi excluded) was  almost a decade ago, actually. I really don't watch much of anything at all.

because it's an animation that uses a software that was designed for making jrpg's and love sims.

anime is short for animation. im not sure where the word cartoon comes from, but they're basically the same thing with just different art styles.

It's Simon Blackquill from Ace Attorney Dual Destinies with his pet hawk, Taka. This guy is the best prosecutor.

That right there is his laughing animation when he sometimes tell a joke.
